alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 5:47PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS AND HIGH SURF EXPECTED ACROSS THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA FRIDAY AND SATURDAY... A potent storm system, the extra-tropical remnants of Typhoon Merbok, is expected to move from the Northern Pacific Thursday through the Southern Bering Thursday night and Friday morning into the Northern Bering Sea for late Friday into Saturday. This system will undergo rapid cyclogenesis as it moves through the Bering Sea, deepening from 965 mb Thursday to around 945 mb by Friday afternoon. While there is still some uncertainty on the exact track and strength of this system, model guidance is converging on a track taking the low from near Attu Island Thursday afternoon to Saint Matthew Island by Saturday morning. For the Kuskokwim Delta, winds are expected to increase by late morning Friday and continue through Saturday morning before slowly diminishing Saturday night. Sustained winds of 40 to 55 mph with higher gusts are possible, especially along the Kuskokwim Delta coast. The combination of strong winds and fetch will also produce a storm surge along the Kuskokwim Delta coast, leading to the potential for coastal erosion and flooding. Current guidance is indicating a potential surge of 5 to 7 feet above mean higher high water (grassline) along the entirety of the Kuskokwim Delta coast, including Kuskokwim Bay. We will continue to closely monitor this storm. Those with interests on or near the Kuskokwim Delta Coast should keep close tabs on this storm and be prepared to take protective actions. For additional information and updates to forecasts, please visit www.weather.gov/afc.
